title: Vocabulary and Context Clues

vocab.definition: All the words you know and understand
Words or sentences around an unknown word that help you figure out its meaning
A word that means the same or almost the same as another word
A word that means the opposite of another word

teachingNotes: Practice using context clues in real texts. Create vocabulary journals. Use graphic organizers for new words.

sample.question: In the sentence 'The enormous elephant was much bigger than the tiny mouse,' what does 'enormous' mean?

truefalse.question: Context clues can help you understand words you've never seen before.
expectedAny: surrounding words provide hints about unknown word meanings

multiplechoice.question: Which are synonyms?
expectedAny: happy and glad mean the same thing

fillintheblank.question: When you come to a word you don't know, look at the other words around it for _____ _____.

shortanswer.question: What are different ways to learn the meaning of new words?
expectedAny: figure it out from the sentence
